definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Both his parents fought in it.
sentences.chinese: 他的雙親都參與了此次戰鬥。

sentences.english: But his parents divorced in the end.
sentences.chinese: 但，不久後，雙親還是離了婚。

sentences.english: Only Duan is left to look after his parents.
sentences.chinese: 只有段留下來照顧他的雙親。

sentences.english: The children treated their parents with filial respect.
sentences.chinese: 這些孩子孝敬他們的雙親。

sentences.english: She look anxiously at her parents as if entreat forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她憂慮地看着她的雙親，好像在請求寬恕。

sentences.english: The kite is my dearest parents.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏的人便是我至親至愛的雙親。

sentences.english: This means every data entry has a parent except the root entry.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着除了根條目之外，每個數據都擁有雙親。

sentences.english: Each family included a couple, along with two sets of parents.
sentences.chinese: 每個家庭都有一對夫婦，並各自都有雙親。

sentences.english: Thank God for good health of all of our parents.
sentences.chinese: 爲健民的媽媽及慧嫦的雙親健康感恩。

sentences.english: In chapter two we synthesized four linear-chain polymerizable amphiphiles.
sentences.chinese: 第二章的工作設計合成了多個直鏈型可聚合雙親分子。

sentences.english: Many children see one of their parents part of the time.
sentences.chinese: 許多孩子只是生活的部分時間見一見雙親之一。

sentences.english: Who will look after the little boy while his parents are out?
sentences.chinese: 那小男孩的雙親出去時，誰來照顧他呢？

sentences.english: Over time the church festival blended with the Mothering Sunday celebration.
sentences.chinese: 這種教堂裏的慶祝活動不斷與“拜望雙親日”相混合。

sentences.english: He is immersed in his work, in order to recovers from the pain of lossing parents.
sentences.chinese: 他埋頭工作爲的是要從失去雙親的痛苦中恢復過來。

sentences.english: She looked anxiously at her parents as if entreating forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她憂慮地看著她的雙親，好像在請求寬恕。

definition: elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
